column1: #Text=In this study, polycrystalline samples were prepared by the high-pressure synthesis method using a cubic-anvil-type apparatus (Riken CAP-07).
#Text=As (chip), Fe (coarse powder), Fe2O3 (powder), Ln (chip) (all purities ≥ 99.9%) are used as the starting materials.

#Text=First, LnAs was synthesized by reacting Ln and As chips at 500 °C for 15 hours, and then 850°C – 950°C for Ln=La, Ce, Pr, Nd and Sm, or 1000 °C for Ln=Gd, Tb and Dy for 5 hours in an evacuated quartz tube.
#Text=The purity of LnAs phase was confirmed every time by the powder X-ray diffraction (XRD) analysis.
#Text=LnAs, Fe and Fe2O3 were mixed at nominal compositions of LnFeAsO1-y (y=0.60 - 0.70) and ground by an agate mortar in a glove box filled with dry nitrogen gas.
#Text=The mixed powder was pressed into a pellet.
#Text=The pellet was heated in a BN crucible at about 1050-1150°C under a pressure of about 2.0 to 5.5 GPa for 2 h.
#Text=The synthesis temperature was 1050-1100°C for Ln=Gd, Tb, Dy, and 1100-1150°C for Ln=La, Ce, Pr, Nd and Sm.
#Text=As described later, the synthesis pressure plays an essential role in synthesizing single-phase samples, in particular for Ln=Gd, Tb and Dy.
